intro: Schinus patagonica, commonly known as the Andean pepper tree, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to South America. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes plants like the cashew and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellow-orange berries that are edible. Schinus patagonica is known for its ability to thrive in arid and semi-arid environments. Its botanical features make it an important species in ecological restoration projects.
